alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 10 at 11:21AM EDT until August 10 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Catoosa County in northwestern Georgia... Northern Dade County in northwestern Georgia... Northwestern Walker County in northwestern Georgia... * Until 530 PM EDT Wednesday. * At 1121 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Trenton, Fort Oglethorpe, Rossville, Lookout Mountain, Morganville, Wildwood, New England, Hooker, Chattanooga Valley, Stephensville, Cole City, Fairview and Lakeview. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
